page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT
page.content: As part of our project we asked all the Junior children in our school if they could tell us what their parents did for a living. We received l1l replies about Mothers and l09 about Fathers ( 2 children did not know what their Fathers did). We found that most mothers worked locally and were housewives, cleaners or health workers in homes for the elderley or mentally infirm. A few mums worked in the fields for Mr. Holland the farmer or Notcutts Nursery.Most mums did jobs did jobs that fitted in with school hours. The jobs for fathers were more varied and they had to travel further away to get to work. The most common jobs were in the construction industry. Then came driving, agriculture/horticulture, and the electronic and computing industry i.e. high technology staff at British Telecom at Martlesham.
